font.br: Welcome to Rantoul Township High School

RTHS exists to prepare students for future success.​
​

br.font: At RTHS there is a climate of high expectations for success. A collaborative culture exists ensuring students' progress is monitored and communicated to students, parents, community, and one another.

td.div:
​In an effort to become more eco-friendly, RTHS will begin the implementation of a "Go Paperless" initiative, which allows parents and guardians the option to access their student’s official academic progress reports and report cards electronically through Skyward. In other words, parents and guardians will view academic information about their student rather than receive printed reports through the U.S. mail.
If you don’t remember your login information, no problem, simply contact Ms. Holly Kelly at hollykelly@rths193.org to request your login information.
If, however, your family would prefer to get a paper copy you have the opportunity to opt-out of the paperless initiative. Simply, click HERE to access the opt-out form or stop by the RTHS main office to register for this opt-out option.

​The Rantoul Township High School Board of Education has completed it's first step in re-developing the goals for the District. With the help of a representative from the Illinois Association of School Boards, they have developed a tentative set of goals. The next step is to gather community input on these goals. The Board will conduct four community forums in different locations in order to do this. Each forum will begin at 6:00 pm, where there will be a presentation on what the Board has done so far and then an interactive session with participants to gather input on the goals. Community members are encouraged to attend any forum that best fits their schedule. The forums will be at the following locations;
Gifford Grade School - November 18th
Thomasboro Grade School - December 4th
Rantoul Township High School Cafetorium - December 5th
Ludlow Grade School - December 11th

td.div: RTHS has partnered with Jostens to provide students, staff, and community members with custom RTHS apparel. Click on the photo below to access the new web store and check it out!

Guarantee Trust Life Insurance Company .

div.font: Get event updates and cancellations sent right to your email. Go to athletics2000.com/RantoulHS/. Under the photos, click on Email Alerts. Create an account and you will receive updates as they are completed.

td.div: Student wellness, including good nutrition and physical activity, shall be promoted in the District's educational program, school activities, and meal programs. To read more about this, please refer to Board Policy 6.50 - School Wellness.

div.font:
A new web page from the villiage website has been constructed for any anonymous or non-anonymous tips that RTHS students, parents or community members can share directly to the SRO's email address for any safety concerns they may have, such as threats of violence, drugs, weapons, or bullying issues, etc. The site can be accessed at www.myrantoul.com/RTHStips or a link can be accessed from the SRO Twitter account at https://twitter.com/RthsSroBuckely
​Users do not need to leave any personal information.
If you'd like to add an event or report an error, please contact RTHS Events

td.div: RTHS is now live streaming select events. Click here.

Mr. Wilson has created a page called the 411 to provide parents, staff, and students important updates and information. Click on his photo to access the page and be sure to check back often for updates!
